summary: Elizabeth is calling for universal free public college and cancelling student loan debt for 42 million Americans. It’s time to cancel student debt and make universal free college a reality.
display_title: Affordable Higher Education for All

summary: Diversity makes our country strong, and we won’t be divided by our differences. It's long past time for common-sense, comprehensive immigration reform.
display_title: A Fair and Welcoming Immigration System

summary: For a long time now, Wall Street’s success hasn’t helped the broader economy — it’s come at the expense of it. It’s time to end Wall Street’s stranglehold on our economy.
display_title: End Wall Street's Stranglehold on Our Economy

summary: Elizabeth warned about an economic crash years before the 2008 crisis, and now she’s seeing serious warning signs again. Congress and regulators should act immediately to tamp down threats before it’s too late.
display_title: The Coming Economic Crash — And How to Stop It

summary: We need to use all the powers of the government to address climate change, and we don’t have any more time to waste. It’s time for bold action to combat climate change before it’s too late.
display_title: Accelerating the Transition to Clean Energy

summary: Women of color face a steeper climb to provide financial security for their families because of systemic discrimination. It’s time to boost wages and open up new pathways to the leadership positions for women of color.
display_title: Valuing the Work of Women of Color

summary: American security and prosperity depend on robust diplomacy -- but the Trump Administration has declared war on the State Department. We must reverse the trend of declining American diplomacy by creating a 21st century foreign service.
display_title: Rebuild the State Department

summary: Our right to vote is under attack—and we need to put more federal muscle in the fight to protect it. It’s time to address election security, administration problems, and voter suppression.
display_title: Strengthening Our Democracy

summary: Private prison companies have spent millions to use our criminal and immigration policies to themselves rich instead of keeping us safe. It’s time to ban private prisons and detention centers, and stop profit-driven cruelty against incarcerated people.
display_title: End Private Prisons

summary: Not every entrepreneur starts out with an equal chance at success. It’s time to close the startup capital gap for entrepreneurs of color.
display_title: Leveling the Playing Field for Entrepreneurs of Color

summary: Giant companies that like to call themselves "American" only have one real loyalty — to their shareholders, not American workers. We need to defend American jobs and make American workers our highest priority.
display_title: Defend & Create American Jobs

summary: The climate crisis demands immediate and bold action. We should bank on American ingenuity and American workers to lead the global effort to face down this threat — and create more than a million good jobs here at home.
display_title: Leading in Green Manufacturing

summary: Impeachment isn't supposed to be the only way that a President can be held accountable for committing a crime. Congress should make it clear that Presidents can be indicted for criminal activity, including obstruction of justice. And when she's President, she will appoint Justice Department officials who will reverse flawed policies so no President is shielded from criminal accountability.
display_title: No President is Above the Law

summary: Extremist Republican lawmakers are trying to turn back the clock and deny women access to reproductive health care. Congress should pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care from right-wing ideologues in the states.
display_title: Protect a Woman's Right to Choose

summary: Coziness between defense lobbyists, Congress, and the Pentagon tilts countless decisions away from national security interests and toward the desires of giant corporations. Let's shut the revolving door between giant contractors and the Pentagon and crack down on corruption.
display_title: Reduce Corporate Influence at the Pentagon

summary: Climate change is already undermining the way the Pentagon operates. But instead of meeting this threat head-on, Washington is ignoring it. The Pentagon should achieve net zero carbon emissions for all its non-combat bases and infrastructure by 2030.
display_title: Our Military Can Help Lead the Fight in Combating Climate Change

summary: In 2017, 70,000 people died from a drug overdose, the highest year on record -- and the majority of those deaths were due to opioids. We need a comprehensive plan to end the opioid crisis.
display_title: Ending the Opioid Crisis

summary: The United States needs leadership that respects all of its citizens, including those living in territories. Puerto Rico needs comprehensive debt relief so it can rebuild and thrive.
display_title: Comprehensive Debt Relief to Puerto Rico

summary: We are facing a maternal mortality crisis in America. And for Black moms, it's an epidemic. One major reason? Racism. It's time to hold health systems accountable and demand change – because women's lives depend on it.
display_title: Addressing Our Maternal Mortality Epidemic

summary: A handful of private contractors have taken over 99% of domestic military family housing, but have failed to maintain the homes they were entrusted with. It’s long past time to improve our military housing, protect families from abuse, and hold private developers accountable.
display_title: Improving Our Military Housing

summary: America’s public lands are one of our greatest treasures. But right now, they’re being sold off to the oil, gas, and coal industries for pennies on the dollar. But it doesn’t have to be this way. protect our public lands — to fight climate change and preserve wild, natural places for future generations.
display_title: Protecting Our Public Lands

summary: You probably pay more in federal income taxes than America’s biggest, most profitable corporations. It’s not right — and we cannot afford to let it continue. massive corporations shouldn’t be able to pay $0 in federal income taxes.
display_title: Real Corporate Profits Tax

summary: Our justice system should ensure that if you cheat working Americans, you'll go to jail. It's time to reform our laws to make sure that corporate executives are held accountable for overseeing massive scams.
display_title: Corporate Executive Accountability Act

summary: Today a farmer can work hard, do everything right — even get great weather — and still not make it. We make big, structural change in our agriculture system — and we can begin by leveling the playing field for America’s family farmers.
display_title: Leveling the Playing Field for America’s Family Farmers

summary: Presidential candidates should have to ask every American in every part of the country for their vote. It’s time to abolish the Electoral College and to have a national popular vote.
display_title: Get Rid of the Electoral College

summary: Elizabeth’s housing plan will lower rents by 10%, help close the racial wealth gap, and create 1.5 million new jobs. Every American deserves a safe and affordable place to live.
display_title: Safe and Affordable Housing

summary: America’s biggest tech companies are controlling more and more of our digital lives and stifling competition in the tech industry. It’s time to break up the biggest tech companies like Amazon, Google, and Facebook.
display_title: How We Can Break Up Big Tech

summary: Elizabeth is fighting to make high-quality child care from birth to school age free for millions of families and affordable for everyone. Let’s make Universal Child Care a reality.
display_title: Universal Child Care

summary: A two-cent tax on the great fortunes of more than $50 million can bring in nearly $3 trillion to rebuild America’s middle class. It's time for the rich to pay their fair share.
display_title: Ultra-Millionaire Tax

summary: Our agriculture system is failing because Big Ag corporations at the top of the supply chain pay artificially low costs while farmers struggle. It’s time to break up big Ag and guarantee farmers a fair shake.
display_title: A New Farm Economy

summary: On average, 100 people are killed in the U.S. by a gun every day — everywhere from our homes, to our streets, to our playgrounds. We need to take action to protect our communities from gun violence.
display_title: Protecting Our Communities from Gun Violence

summary: Elizabeth’s plan will put health care services in reach of every family, create a public option for broadband so every home and business has access to high-speed internet at an affordable price, and build a sustainable farm economy that raises farm incomes and protects our environment. It’s time to restore opportunity in rural communities.
display_title: Investing in Rural America

topic: native americans tribal lands indigenous peoples treaties
summary: The story of America’s mistreatment of Native communities is a long and painful one, rooted in centuries of discrimination, neglect, greed, and violence. America must uphold its commitments and promises to Native and indigenous peoples.
display_title: Honoring and Empowering Tribal Nations and Indigenous Peoples

summary: The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world—yet our harshly punitive system isn’t making our communities safer. It’s long past time for bold, structural change to reform our criminal justice system.
display_title: Comprehensive Criminal Justice Reform

summary: For decades, big multinational corporations have been dictating America’s trade policy at the expense of everyone else. We need to use America’s enormous leverage to completely transform our approach to trade.
display_title: A New Approach to Trade
100% Clean Energy for America
summary: The science is clear. Climate change is caused by human beings and it is accelerating. We need big, structural change, across a range of industries and sectors to solve the climate crisis.

display_title: Expanding Social Security
summary: It’s too hard to save enough for a decent retirement — and it’s only getting harder. We need to expand Social Security.

display_title: Health Care is a Basic Human Right
summary: Health care is a basic human right – and we fight for basic human rights. Elizabeth won’t stop fighting until everyone is covered and no one goes broke paying a medical bill or filling a prescription. We need Medicare for All.
additional_training_text: healthcare healthcare healthcare healthcare healthcare healthcare healthcare

display_title: LGBTQ+ Rights
summary: We need a president who will lift up the voices of LGBTQ+ people and fight back against discrimination. No one should feel unsafe because of who they are or who they love.

display_title: Fighting for an Accessible & Inclusive America
summary: Elizabeth is committed to a Democracy that is accessible to and represents all Americans - including those with disabilities. Our Democracy Must be Representative of and Accessible to People with Disabilities.

display_title: Promoting Competitive Markets
summary: Markets work when there are rules and competition - but corporate monopolies have taken over in sector after sector. It’s time to bring back serious antitrust enforcement.

display_title: Empowering Workers Through Accountable Capitalism
summary: Wealthy shareholders of giant corporations have gobbled up trillions of dollars in surging profits. Giant corporations must focus more on the interests of their workers – not just their wealthy shareholders.

display_title: Foreign Policy
summary: Washington’s foreign policy today serves the wealthy and well-connected at the expense of everyone else. It’s long past time to take an honest look at the full costs and risks of our military spending and overseas actions.

display_title: Tackling the Climate Crisis Head On
summary: Elizabeth is committed to addressing climate change, because our planet depends on it.

display_title: Holding Wall Street Accountable
summary: Elizabeth has spent her career fighting for American families and holding big banks and corporate executives accountable. It’s time to fundamentally transform the financial sector’s role in our economy.

display_title: End Washington Corruption
summary: The Trump administration is the most corrupt administration of our lifetime. But the problem of Washington corruption is much bigger than Trump. We need big, structural change to root out Washington corruption and make government work for all of us.

display_title: Strengthening Congressional Independence from Corporate Lobbyists
summary: When Elizabeth fought for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, she saw firsthand how lobbyists use their resources and expertise to overpower the needs and wishes of ordinary people. It's time to give Congress the resources it needs to fight back against corporate lobbyists.

display_title: Excessive Lobbying Tax
summary: Corporate interests spend more on lobbying than we spend to fund both houses of Congress – more than $2.8 billion in lobbying last year alone. It's time for a tax on excessive lobbying.

display_title: Empowering American Workers and Raising Wages
summary: Returning power to working people will be the overarching goal of my presidency. It's time for the most progressive and comprehensive agenda for workers since the New Deal.

display_title: Restoring Trust in an Impartial and Ethical Judiciary
summary: The basic premise of our legal system is that every person is treated equally in the eyes of the law – including judges. It’s time to strengthen the integrity and impartiality of the federal judiciary.

display_title: Fighting For Justice As We Combat The Climate Crisis
summary: Justice must be at the center of our response to climate change. And we need big, bottom-up change - focused on, and led by, the communities who have been in this fight since the beginning.

display_title: Getting Big Money Out of Politics
summary: Our democracy shouldn’t be bought and paid for by the wealthy and powerful. We need big structural changes to campaign finance laws to get big money out of politics.

display_title: A Great Public School Education for Every Student
summary: I believe in America’s public schools. It’s time to give our schools the support they need to ensure that every student has access to a meaningful, high-quality public education.

display_title: Breaking the Political Influence of Market-Dominant Companies
summary: Massive, market-dominant corporations stack their ranks with former senior government officials who can leverage their government contacts for corporate gain. It's time to slam shut the revolving door between government and the nation's most powerful companies.

display_title: Ending the Stranglehold of Health Care Costs on American Families
summary: My Medicare for All plan gives everyone good insurance and cuts their health care costs to nearly zero - without increasing middle-class taxes one penny. We need Medicare for All to be the law of the land.

display_title: Keeping Our Promises to Our Service Members, Veterans, and Military Families
summary: All three of Elizabeth's brothers served in the military – so she knows the sacrifices that our service members and their families make for our country. We need to provide our service members, military families, and veterans with the benefits they have earned.

display_title: Fighting Corporate Perjury
summary: Fossil fuel companies like Exxon shouldn't be able to pour money into fake junk science, then use it to lie to federal regulators. It's time to end corporate perjury.

display_title: My First Term Plan for Reducing Health Care Costs in America and Transitioning to Medicare for All
summary: My plan for health care reverses the Trump Administration's sabotage of our health care, allows everyone in America to choose a Medicare for All option for little or no cost, and cuts costs for families before moving us into full Medicare for All - all in my first term. We need Medicare for All.

display_title: Protecting and Empowering Renters
summary: Everyone should have a decent, affordable, and safe place to live. I’ll fight to uphold the rights of tenants against exploitative landlords, tackle the growing cost of rent, and invest in healthy and green homes for all. Let’s protect and empower renters.

display_title: Fighting Back Against White Nationalist Violence
summary: When our neighbors are persecuted or attacked, that impacts all of us. I will make combating white nationalist violence a priority. Join me in standing up to hate.

display_title: A Working Agenda for Black America
summary: We must recognize the systemic discrimination that infects our country, and we must work actively - and deliberately - to root it out and set us on a better path. This agenda is a work in progress and will continue to be updated based on input and insight from Black activists, community leaders, organizers, policy experts, and stakeholders.

display_title: A Fair Workweek for America’s Part-Time Workers
summary: Unpredictable work schedules leave millions of part-time workers with no control over their time. My Fair Workweek plan gives these workers more control and financial security. We need to help shift power back to part-time workers.
